content.description:
This route is the first route that you come to on The SeniorWall.  As the trail from The Far Side goes back to the rockat Senior Wall, this is the first route you encounter.  Thisis located 150 or so feet East of the rest of the boltedclimbs on the senior wall.

Climb the rock obviously stained and worn down by spring andwinter rains.  Getting off the ground and the first 15 feetare probably 5.4, and there is another section about 65 feetup that is the "crux".

Walk off the top, and then back down the orginal path intothe backside of Table Mountain.
content.protection: Anything will fit.  Just bring as much gear as youdesire, or solo it, it's not that hard!

content.description: Sustained and one of the steeper routes at the wall. Felt a bit pumpier than its neighbors left (Luc Skywalker) and right (Senior Project). The crux seems to be between the 4th and the 5th bolt.
content.location: Between Luc Skywalker and Senior Project (as of March 2021)

content.description: Some hard moves at the bottom 3 bolts lead to easier climbing with good hands and feet.
content.location: This is the second route from the left on Senior Wall

climbs.name: Senioritis
climbs.fa: Roger Putnam, Robin Batha, Joel Primrose, January 18, 2016.

content.description: Fun slightly technical wandery route on Senior Wall.
content.protection: 8 bolts to two bolt anchor with mussy hooks
content.location: Starts 40 feet to the right of Depends.

content.description: This climb runs along the 4th set of bolts from the right at Senior Wall.  The climb is a slightly overhung jug haul with a crux section after the 4th bolt.  The route does a certain amount of meandering left and right; one might want to bring some long draws and/or slings.  Some rock is loose on this climb, and it's pretty pumpy overall.
content.protection: This climb has 8 bolts to a 3 chain anchor.

content.description: This climb follows the 7th bolt line from the rightmost bolts at Senior Wall, and shares its top anchor with Fat Don't Fly (5.10b).  Climb up to a scary move just above the 2nd bolt.  Jugs lie ahead until the 6th bolt, where friction and slopey action must suffice.  Keep your eye out for hidden holds.

climbs.name: Senior Discount
climbs.fa: Roger Putnam, Robin Putnam & John Greer, February 2017

content.description: Well protected, fun route. Felt a little harder than Senioritis. Crux is at the 5th bolt
content.protection: 8 bolts to two chain anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: About 5 meters to the left of Senioritis, and another 5 meters to the right of Depends.

content.description:
This is the third route to the left of the Waterfall Route,and is also the third set of bolts from the right.

Head straight up for five bolts using large  but hiddenjogs.  Bear a little right and move up from ledge to ledgefor the left few bolts.

Do your rope a faver and rappell from the top anchors .

Watch out for poison oak on the base of this route.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.

content.description: This climb is the 5th from the rightmost set of bolts at Senior Wall.  This juggy route is slightly more overhung than its neighbor Senior Project (5.10b).  Harder sections after 1st bolt and right beneath the anchors, but the route has plenty of rests.

This route is 6th bolted route from the rightmost set of bolts at Senior Wall.  Climb up and right at the 2nd bolt, and then back up and left at the 4th.  This fun climb is full of interesting, hidden handholds.  Footwork is key in the crux section just after the 2nd bolt.  The top of the climb is somewhat sustained, but is probably only 5.8 or 5.9 difficulty.

40 Feet to the left to Senioritis.Head up the easy run out start on a slab to a vertical section after the second bolt that continues for several bolts. Once you reach the mantle move and get up the final slab, you're done. Climb right then up to the anchor shared with Assisted Living (5.9).This is the easiest sport route on the backside of TableMountain.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 ring top anchor, which is sharedwith Assisted Living (5.9).

content.description:
This is the second bolted route from the right, JUST left ofDepends.

Head up a juggy start that leads to vertical sections ofliebacks and other interesting 5.9ish moves.  Fun withbuttlocks and other oddities if you choose.  This route wasdefinately a little pumpy for a 5.9, but that's good!

The climbing angles right at the end to a shared top anchorwith Depends (5.8).
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 ring top anchor, which is sharedwith Depends (5.8).
